title: Angelina Jolie returns to spotlight after Brad Pitt split to promote Netflix movie in Cambodia
text:

Angelina Jolie has been keeping a very low profile since the breakdown of her marriage to Brad Pitt. 
But she returned to the limelight today, making her first public appearance since the split in order to promote her new film, First They Killed My Father. 
Angelina, 41, flashed a huge smile for the cameras as she took part in a press conference for the movie, while she co-wrote and directed, based on Loung Ung’s memoirs from the Khmer Rouge years. 
It’s a project close to Angelina’s heart, as she adopted her first child, son Maddox, now 15, from a Cambodian orphanage in 2002. Angelina is in Cambodia to launch the film (Photo: Getty) Hollywood star Angelina speaks to media during a press conference (Photo: Getty) With Cambodian child actress Sareum Srey Moch (Photo: Getty) 
She first spent time in the country while filming Lara Croft: Tomb Raider, and has returned many times over the years to complete charitable work. 
According to People , Angelina told reporters she’d read Loung’s memoirs many years ago, adding: “It helped to open my eyes to what was going on the world. I wanted to tell the story to through the eyes of the child’s point of view, the love of a family, to show the beauty of the country and understand what Maddox’s parents may have gone through.” 
Loung was only five years old when the Khmer Rouge - Cambodia’s communist party - took control. Her memoirs recount what it was like to live during that era and see both her parents and two sisters executed.
